Implementation approach: We will utilize the Pygame library to create a grid-based game board with smooth snake movement and collision detection. The game will feature a simple yet visually appealing UI with clear instructions and a scoring system.
Data structures and interfaces:
classDiagram
    class Game {
        -board: Board
        -snake: Snake
        -food: Food
        -score: int
        +__init__() None
        +run() None
        +handle_events() None
        +update() None
        +render() None
    }
    class Board {
        -width: int
        -height: int
        -grid: list
        +__init__(width: int, height: int) None
        +draw_grid() None
    }
    class Snake {
        -body: list
        -direction: str
        +__init__() None
        +move() None
        +grow() None
    }
    class Food {
        -x: int
        -y: int
        +__init__() None
        +generate_new_position() None
    }
    Game --> Board
    Game --> Snake
    Game --> Food
    Snake --> Board
Program call flow:
sequenceDiagram
    participant G as Game
    participant B as Board
    participant S as Snake
    participant F as Food
    G->>G: __init__()
    G->>B: draw_grid()
    G->>S: move()
    G->>F: generate_new_position()
    G->>G: handle_events()
    G->>G: update()
    G->>G: render()
    S->>B: check_collision()
    F->>S: check_consumption()
    G->>G: run()
Anything UNCLEAR: Clarification needed on the specific graphics library or framework for Python, but Pygame is assumed to be used. Additionally, the project requirements do not specify any particular audio effects or soundtracks.
